Almost immediately upon his return home, the young defenceman was approached by the Winnipeg Monarchs, but with next to no money put on the table by the team, Maxwell waited for a better offer to come his way; he got it shortly afterward when the Wheat Kings offered $300 a month for his services. Maxwell happily took them up on it and spent the next two seasons playing out of the old Wheat City Arena, winning the MJHL title in 1950.
